description: Remainder when (n-1)! + 1 is divided by n.
comments: Related to Wilson's theorem. a(n) = 0 iff n = 1 or a prime; a(n) = 1 iff n 4 is composite > 4; a(n) = 3 iff n = 4.
references: Albert H. Beiler, Recreations in The Theory of Numbers, The Queen of Mathematics Entertains, Second Edition, Dover Publications, Inc., New York, 1966, Page 50.
maple: P:=proc(q) local n; for n from 0 to q do print((n!+1) mod (n+1));od; end: P(100); # _Paolo P. Lava_, Jun 16 2014
author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jul 23 2000
